review_title: Worst experience of my career to date - Avoid if you value your health
pros: Salary, bonuses, and working from home arrangement
cons:
This organisation treats people like commodities in a way I have never experienced before in my life. It was the most dehumanised I have ever felt. They talk a good game when it comes to mental health and team bonding, but you can see the fear in the staff's eyes during every interaction. Show any weakness at all and you will be toast. During my time there the threat of redundancy was held over everyone's heads as if it were their chosen management tool, and to a point it worked! They had people working 12 hour days, played people off against each other for roles that may or may not appear in 6 months time, and hired people knowing they would have to make them redundant. The CEOs absolute single minded approach to their "mission" is at the expense of the health and wellbeing of every single staff member. I don't think he understands the concept of looking after your staff to help get the best out of them. Tears every day, people off sick, having to pay people off due to their mistreatment of them.
Tax payers money very poorly spent - they are equipping the Police force with poorly "trained" officers, and lining the pockets of the few at the top.

job_title: Trainee Detective Constable in Birmingham, England
pros: - The exposure allows for trainee detectives to experience a number of different scenarios earlier on within the academy and helps to build confidence.
cons: - Sometimes, the workload could be a lot.

pros: Weekends and bank holidays off
cons: Heads of department on £70k plus whilst the officers and coordinators are on £25-£35 doing work way beyond their pay grade. Promotion process is unfair. While they claim to improve the diversity of police officers they do nothing to support the diversity of their staff. This company typically attracts middle class privileged people and the operations and structures are designed to suit those people.

review_title: Worst company i have worked for
pros: The goal of the company is much needed
cons: Poor management, Poor work life balance, management create lies when they want to push you out. No diversity. Employees constantly leaving which says a lot about the company.

pros: Starting a new role can be a daunting experience however, having joined Police Now I am really pleased to say that my induction has been great. Everyone is so welcoming and nice. There is certainly a cohesive sense of purpose.

pros: good culture inclusive and collaborative

pros:
- Generally young, passionate and committed staff group 
- Reasonably nice office, and flexible/remote working is very normal. 
- Overall mission is superb, generally well understood by all, and makes a real difference.
cons:
- Salaries for lower grades are really poor, so attract inexperienced people. In a small organisation, that makes a big difference to how effective it is. 
- ENORMOUS gulf in experience/skills/capability of senior management (largely skewed to the lower end) makes for small “islands” of talent and productivity, dwarfing low performing teams.

pros: I am relatively new to the company but from the very first day, actually even throughout the lengthy unfortunate lockdown recruitment process, it was clear that the whole company shared a core understanding and belief in its values, vision and mission. There is an active and genuine desire to really make a difference. In fact, there is structure in place to empower its employees to make a REAL difference in both their work life and personal life. The whole team is collaborative and open to different opinion. The company works tirelessly to break barriers and change the status quo, its work on diversity and inclusion is brilliant. I am proud of what I do, and especially who I work for.
cons: I am unable to find any yet...?
